pathAssistantSteps.info: The process begins when an inquiry arrives via phone, email, the website, or a walk-in. Regardless of the source essential details are gathered

If there is positive engagement, the CSA books a "show round," which is a physical visit to the care home. This stage involves "mini checklists" to ensure the environment is prepared - such as ensuring tea and coffee are available - and requires coordinating the calendars of home managers and clinical leads

For those wishing to proceed after a show round, a clinical lead conducts a pre-admission assessment. This is usually done offsite (e.g., at a hospital) to determine if the home can cater to the person's specific medical and care needs. If the home cannot meet those needs, the enquiry may be referred to another Colten Care location

Once the clinical assessment is approved, the team agrees on an admission date and confirms the room rate. For permanent residents, this stage includes a financial summary reviewed by the CEO to ensure the resident has suitable funding for the services provided

The final administrative hurdle involves signing the Terms of Residence (which requires a "wet signature" for legal reasons), consent forms, and direct debit information. After these are uploaded and the initial payment is confirmed by the payroll team, the individual is officially admitted as either a respite or permanent resident
